image.altText: Tim Mathieson, the partner of Julia Gillard, sits in a crowd

items.synopsis: Lawyers for Tim Mathieson, the former partner of Julia Gillard, say he will plead guilty to a charge of sexual assault during a hearing in the Melbourne Magistrates' Court.

title.children: Tim Mathieson, former partner of Julia Gillard, to plead guilty to sexual assault charge

image.altText: Greg Jenkins 1

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank is hiking interest rates — and hitting borrowers — to fight high inflation, but data suggests the fight is being undermined by big-spending baby boomers.

title.children: 'We're not paying the price': The boomers boosting inflation as the RBA lifts rates to fight it

image.altText: A composite image of Kevin Spacey clutching an Oscar and a court sketch

items.synopsis: The trial against Kevin Spacey was a strange mix of celebrity witnesses, tearful testimony and graphic allegations of sexual violence. WARNING: Some readers may find details in this story distressing.

title.children: Kevin Spacey was one of the biggest names hit by #MeToo. Here's why a London court cleared him

image.altText: Image of couple in front of cancelled and sign and Metricon label

items.synopsis: Metricon, the biggest home builder in the country, has told some customers to pay painfully higher prices or risk losing their new homes and deposits in a contract nightmare affecting home owners.

title.children: Building giant tells buyers to pay hundreds of thousands extra or lose homes and deposits

image.altText: A Dutch player dribbles the ball as she is challenged by a USA opponent at the Women's World Cup.

items.synopsis: The USA and Netherlands finish deadlocked at 1-1 across the Tasman, as Australia prepares to cheer on the Matildas in their next group match against Nigeria this evening. Follow live.

title.children: USA, Netherlands play out tense World Cup draw

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Dramatic group-stage match, and it ends in a draw. After all that, the US will be more disappointed not to get the win, as they were so dominant after getting that equaliser. They looked unstoppable once they had their full array of attacking talent going full throttle, so well done to the Dutch for holding out. Still, I think it has shown some chinks in the US armour, as they looked pretty rattled for much of that first half and some of the second. Rose Lavelle, who I maintain is the best player to watch in the world, added the dynamism the US needed in the second half. I expect she'll start for them in the next game.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FULL-TIME: USA 1 - 1 Netherlands

children.content: Dramatic group-stage match, and it ends in a draw. After all that, the US will be more disappointed not to get the win, as they were so dominant after getting that equaliser.
They looked unstoppable once they had their full array of attacking talent going full throttle, so well done to the Dutch for holding out.
Still, I think it has shown some chinks in the US armour, as they looked pretty rattled for much of that first half and some of the second.
Rose Lavelle, who I maintain is the best player to watch in the world, added the dynamism the US needed in the second half. I expect she'll start for them in the next game.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Just as Van de Donk seemed to rile her up, Lindsey Horan does brilliantly from the corner, angling her run to the near post and heading home with power. It's 1-1! Really great header when you see it on replay, diverted with venom into the top corner.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 62' HORAN scores for USA! It's 1-1

children.content: Just as Van de Donk seemed to rile her up, Lindsey Horan does brilliantly from the corner, angling her run to the near post and heading home with power.
Really great header when you see it on replay, diverted with venom into the top corner.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: What a monumental scoreline. Is the USA's air of invulnerability about the be breached? The Americans had the early run of play, and it was virtually the first chance for the Dutch that they put away, but since that point they have certainly matched their opponents. If anything I think they had the better half. They did well to break up play with some tactical fouling, and have frustrated the US midfield, who can't get any flow going. The USA need the get the ball to Sophia Smith more frequently, and I wouldn't be surprised if we see Rose Lavelle on at half time. The US, winners of the last two World Cups, look rattled.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: HALF-TIME: USA 0 - 1 Netherlands

children.content: What a monumental scoreline. Is the USA's air of invulnerability about the be breached?
The Americans had the early run of play, and it was virtually the first chance for the Dutch that they put away, but since that point they have certainly matched their opponents.
If anything I think they had the better half. They did well to break up play with some tactical fouling, and have frustrated the US midfield, who can't get any flow going.
The USA need the get the ball to Sophia Smith more frequently, and I wouldn't be surprised if we see Rose Lavelle on at half time.
The US, winners of the last two World Cups, look rattled.

image.altText: Bald man in army greens holding a gun in front of white wall.

items.synopsis: One of the top leaders in the Russian Army, Sergei Surovikin, has not been seen since the mutiny against the Kremlin last month. At first it seems odd, but it turns out General Surovikin is not who he seems.

title.children: Russian 'General Armageddon' Sergei Surovikin is missing — is he 'resting' or Resting In Peace?

image.altText: A composite image of Sinead O'Conner and Prince

items.synopsis: Despite being Sinéad O'Connor's most recognisable song, Nothing Compares 2 U originally came from the pen of Prince.

title.children: Nothing Compares 2 U: How the song of 1990 went from Prince to Sinéad and back again

image.altText: Sinead O'connor wearing a priests black outfit with a cross holding a microphone and smiling

items.synopsis: Irish singer-songwriter Sinéad O'Connor, who became a superstar in her mid-20s, dies at 56.

title.children: Sinéad O'Connor, who topped charts in the 90s, dies aged 56

image.altText: A woman in a green top stands against a stone wall.

items.synopsis: Sarab was 11 when ISIS militants attacked her village and sold her into slavery. Five years later, she had been given to six different men. Now, she wants justice, writes Stephanie March.

title.children: Abducted and sold into slavery at 11, now Sarab wants justice

image.altText: Kirrawee nursing home Joan Hobbs

items.synopsis: The family of Joan Hobbs have called for better staffing after the 89-year-old woman was attacked by a fellow dementia patient with a walking frame.

title.children: Elderly woman allegedly bashed to death by fellow dementia patient in Sydney nursing home

image.altText: Two Minimocursor phunoiensis, who have pink heads, orange beak-like mouths, long necks and tiny arms

items.synopsis: Researchers say the young creature, which was about the size of a dog, is "one of the best-preserved dinosaurs ever found in South-East Asia".

title.children: New species of dinosaur discovered in Thailand

image.altText: Composite image of football fans from the 32 nations competing at the FIFA Women's World Cup

items.synopsis: With the FIFA Women's World Cup in full swing, fans all around Australia show their true colours and share their passion for the world game, and their country.

title.children: Here's what it means to football fans from all over the world to see a Women's World Cup here

image.altText: The back of a man and a woman looking out across a ledge where smoke burns

items.synopsis: As temperatures rise and seas warm experts say there is a lot more to consider when planning your next overseas holiday..

title.children: Popular holiday destinations are paying the price of climate change. Here's how tourists don't have to

image.altText: An african man sitting infront of a white table and microphone with nine men in military uniforms behind him

items.synopsis: Colonel Amadou Abdramane appears in a video saying Niger's defence forces are putting an end to President Mohamed Bazoum's regime.

title.children: Niger soldiers remove president, seize power in coup

image.altText: ukraine ships

items.synopsis: Russia refuses to speak at a UN Security Council meeting called to discuss Moscow's recent devastating attacks on the key Ukranian port of Odesa immediately following its exit from the Black Sea grain deal.

title.children: Russia refuses to speak at UN meeting on Ukraine port attacks, calls meeting on religious freedom in Ukraine

image.altText: Photograph outside the Australian Tax Office headquarters

items.synopsis: The Australian Tax Office privately settled with PwC over its confidentiality breach in March, at a time when the consulting firm was still claiming the scandal was contained to a single former partner.

title.children: Tax Office privately settled with PwC before full scale of tax leak was known

image.altText: Jerome Powell stands at a podium behind a wall of American flags.

items.synopsis: The ASX has set a 100-day high as the market continues to digest yesterday's better than expected inflation numbers, while in the US, stocks finished flat as the Federal Reserve hikes interest rates to a 22-year high. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Fed 'prepared to raise further' as rates hit 22-year high, ASX up in early trade

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Australian investment bank Macquarie Group's shares are down almost 5 per cent today after it highlighted a lower quarterly profit. In its update to the market, the group said low green energy investment-related income at its asset management arm had weighed on earnings. Macquarie did not give a profit figure in its quarterly update. Analysts at Citi said in a noted the group appeared to be anticipating further weakness through the 2024 fiscal year. "We think this reflects the collapse in YoY volatility in gas prices, consistent with declining capital consumption in CGM," analysts at Citi said. Macquarie Group flagged that trading activity in Macquarie Capital was expected to be up despite a challenging 2023.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Macquarie Group flags lower profit on weak green energy income

children.content: In its update to the market, the group said
low green energy investment-related income at its asset management arm had weighed on earnings
Macquarie did not give a profit figure in its quarterly update.
Analysts at Citi said in a noted the group appeared to be
anticipating further weakness through the 2024 fiscal year
"We think this reflects the collapse in YoY volatility in gas prices, consistent with declining capital consumption in CGM," analysts at Citi said.
Macquarie Group flagged that trading activity in Macquarie Capital was expected to be up despite a challenging 2023.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Australia's fourth-biggest lender, ANZ, has increased the rate on its basic variable home loan by up to 0.15 percentage points, for new customers. Here's a table prepared by comparison site RateCity. According to RateCity, between them, the big four banks have increased at least one advertised new customer rate on 18 occasions since the start of March. Oh, and note the note in the table below about these hikes being on top of the RBA increases.

image.altText: John Woodman sits in a chair in front of a microphone against a wooden wall as he testifies at the IBAC hearing in Melbourne.

image.altText: Shooting scene

items.synopsis: Police say a fatal shooting in Canterbury early this morning is believed to be a targeted incident. It comes less than 24 hours after a separate incident where a lawyer was shot.

title.children: Police probe 'common link' between recent Sydney shootings after man gunned down in city's south-west

image.altText: The view over nepal from a paraglider.
